name: "King Kong" (2005) : Part II Quiz | King Kong | 10 Questions

questions.text: Carl Denham and his crew happen upon mysterious ruins on Skull Island.  Oddly enough, they also discover that there is no human presence whatsoever on the entire island.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Heck, you knew this one!  The island, at least behind the very large walls of the ruins, is populated by some rather frightening-looking natives.  They offer up Ann Darrow in a sacrificial ritual to Kong.

questions.text: Not long after their arrival on the island, Ann Darrow is nabbed by King Kong, a giant gorilla-like creature who appears to be a native inhabitant.  Do any of the film's or ship's crew get a look at the beast?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Carl Denham gets an eyeful of Kong.  Feigning concern for Ann, Carl insists that a rescue attempt be made, but what he is really concerned about is getting some film footage of the giant simian. Interestingly, the viewer doesn't get to view Kong until over an hour into the film!

questions.text: After pushing through the jungle for quite some time, Ann in hand, Kong settles down on a rock precipice.  Here, Ann attempts to impress Kong with several tricks from her vaudeville act.  Which of these does she not perform for Kong?
questions.explanation:
Push-ups.

	Ann looks for a way to make some kind of connection with Kong, perhaps imagining that if she were to amuse him, he might not kill her.  It seems to work.  Kong is amused by her antics and even becomes a bit playful with Ann.

questions.text: Carl Denham, Jack Driscoll and crew appear hot on the heels of Kong and the missing Ann.  On their way, they encounter a host of wild creatures and beasts, the likes of which they could never have imagined.  Which of these is not descriptive of some of the creatures they encounter?
questions.explanation:
Giant lions and tigers.

	The crew become involved in a brontosaurus (aka apatosaurus) stampede before being trapped in a murky ravine with some of the most disgusting insects and giant tube worms ever depicted in film.  The scene with the insects is an homage to the original 1933-version of 'King Kong' where a scene with man-eating spiders was cut because the studio decided it was too scary!

questions.text: Despite their desperate attempts, the crew of the ship is unable to capture Kong, and several members of the crew are lost.  Fortunately, the remaining members are saved when the captain of the ship comes with reinforcements.  Alongside the captain is the lead actor of the film that Carl Denham is making.  Played by Kyle Chandler, what is this handsome-looking hero called?
questions.explanation:
Bruce Baxter.

	Bruce Baxter is an interesting character.  He abandons the search for Ann after encountering the first batch of dinosaurs, claiming that he is 'an actor with a gun who has lost his motivation'.  Later, when all seems lost for Carl, Jack and the remaining crew in the insect pit, Baxter arrives with Captain Englehorn to save their comrades.

questions.text: Back to Kong and Ann, the two of them encounter trouble of their own when Kong has to battle not one, but three massive beasts.  Which type of creature does he fight, three on one?
questions.explanation:
Tyrannosaurus Rex.

	Kong's battle with the tyrannosaurs is possibly the most riveting action sequence in the film.  While battling the tyrannosaurs, Kong, Ann and the three giant carnivorous dinosaurs fall into a deep valley crossed by a number of vines.  Kong is finally able to defeat the tyrannosaurs, tearing the final beast's mouth open a la the original version of 'King Kong'.

questions.text: Ann and Kong make their way to a place where the sunset is clearly visible.  At this point, they share a tender moment together, as they view the beautiful reddish-orange sky together.  Which actor friend of Peter Jackson provides the facial gestures that help bring Kong's emotions alive for the big screen?
questions.explanation:
Andy Serkis.

	You may recognize Andy Serkis's name from Peter Jackson's 'Lord of the Rings' trilogy.  Serkis portrayed Gollum in those three films.  In this film, Serkis is partially responsible for helping the CGI Kong come to life.  Serkis also plays the ship's cook Lumpy in this film.

questions.text: While Kong and Ann view the sunset, what one word does Ann use to describe the scene?
questions.explanation:
Beautiful.

	Ann uses this line several times during this scene, and uses it again when she shares a sunrise with her newfound friend Kong.  The sunset and sunrise scenes are the key scenes in the film in terms of developing the emotional connection between the two characters.

questions.text: After a peaceful time together, Ann and Kong sleep.  Jack arrives to break up this halcyon moment, making an attempt to rescue Ann.  Unfortunately, Kong awakes and a fracas ensues.  During this melee, Kong is attacked by which of these oversized creatures?
questions.explanation:
Bats.

	Jack and Ann climb down a long vine after Kong is attacked by giant vampire bats.  The two of them make it down a river and finally rejoin the ship's crew.

questions.text: Kong pursues Ann, hoping to regain his lost prize.  Unhappily, he is heading towards a trap.  After the trap fails, the remaining members of the ship's crew, along with Carl and his filmmaking crew, make their way frantically towards the ship.  Surprisingly, they are able to capture Kong, when which individual smashes a bottle of chloroform on the great gorilla's face?
questions.explanation:
Carl.

	From an elevated rock, Carl smashes an entire bottle of chloroform on Kong's face, and the giant ape is slowly overcome by the noxious fumes.  Against all odds, Carl has captured Kong and now plans to display his prize to the world. Thank you for playing this quiz.  I hope you have enjoyed it (and will try the others in this series).
